page.title: 15ANCIENT FEATURES NE.PLYMOUTH
page.content: Places mentioned in Domesday include the Saxon manor of Eggbuckland.The manor was near to the church which still stands.The manor was the third largest in the area and was originally on an arm of the sea.It had a saltworks and the only packhorse in the area.Its value was 50 shillings.It retains the name of its last Saxon owner Hecche in Bocland who received the land from a King.Widey Court was built by the Hele family.Its grounds now hold a Primary School and its gatehouse has just been demolished to make way for a new roadway. In the 1860's Palmerston built a ring of forts to protect Plymouth from invasion by Napoleon III.Three forts still exist:Fort Austin is the local refuse lorries centre.Crownhill took its name from the fort there.It was called Knackersknowle until 1890.
